articles.description: Edward Hillel's new book, Holding the Main, serves as a fascinating, bilingual photographic documentary of the boulevard and environs.

articles.title: Queen’s University recruits Ian Karlin from Nvidia in bid to build Canadian supercomputer
articles.description: After working on leading supercomputers abroad, Karlin wants to help boost Canada’s computing capacity. The post Queen’s University recruits Ian Karlin from Nvidia in bid to build Canadian supercomputer first appeared on BetaKit.

articles.title: Astronomers just watched a black hole twist spacetime
articles.description: Astronomers have detected spacetime itself being dragged and twisted by a spinning black hole for the first time. The discovery, seen during a star’s violent destruction, confirms a prediction made over 100 years ago and reveals new clues about how black holes spin and launch jets.

articles.title: Markets today: North American indexes rise, Lululemon surges, top mining picks and more
articles.description: Softer-than-anticipated U.S. CPI boosts rate-cut bets

articles.title: The western U.S. Tried to stop wildfires and it backfired
articles.description: Much of the western U.S. is overdue for wildfire, with decades of suppression allowing fuel to build up across millions of hectares. Researchers estimate that 74% of the region is in a fire deficit, meaning far more land needs to burn to restore healthy forest conditions. Catching up would require a

articles.title: Your body feels cold in two different ways
articles.description: Researchers have uncovered that the body uses different molecular systems to sense cold in the skin versus internal organs. This explains why surface chills feel very different from cold experienced deep inside the body.

articles.title: Mother who lost toddler in 2016 urges people to take the flu seriously
articles.description: Jude, the two-year-old son of Jill Promoli, a mother and school trustee from the Toronto area, died from influenza B.

articles.title: Jewish organization calls for action to protect community after Sydney shooting
articles.description: OTTAWA — A Jewish organization is calling on all levels of government to protect communities in Canada following a mass shooting at a Hanukkah celebration in Australia.
